author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Leafs Fall Short Against Bethel in Crossroads League Showdown
text:
Leafs Fall Short Against Bethel in Crossroads League Showdown
The Maple Leafs fell to the Bethel Pilots in a rivalry match, losing all three sets (25-17, 25-18, 25-17). Goshen led only once early in the first set, with their strongest performance seen in the third set where they tied the score at 15-15 before the Pilots secured the match with a decisive 10-2 run. Despite some standout performances, such as Kassidy Faler's three aces and Amelie Martinez's nine kills, Goshen's efforts were not enough to change the outcome. Bethel now leads the U.S. Highway 20 Cup series 3-0 and has solidified their position in the league standings. This loss eliminates the Leafs from contention for the Crossroads League tournament.
- Goshen recorded 27 kills, while Bethel had 33.
- Kassidy Faler achieved three aces, tying her season high.
- Goshen led in blocks, 7-4, indicating strong defensive performance.
- Both teams were tied in digs, with each having 39, showcasing good defensive efforts from both sides.
The Maple Leafs will face #12 Mount Vernon Nazarene on Saturday, October 25, at 2:00 PM, with the time change from the originally scheduled 3:00 PM. The team's focus will be on improving their standings despite the setback against Bethel.
Bottom LineGoshen's loss highlights the challenges they face in a competitive league, ultimately affecting their ability to qualify for the Crossroads League tournament. Moving forward, they need to capitalize on their strong defensive plays and bolster their offensive strategies to regain momentum.
Read more at Goshen College
